cyclone.name: DELTA
cyclone.current_location: about 550 mi SSE of Cameron, Louisiana
cyclone.trajectory: continuing northwest across the central Gulf, then turning NNW/N and accelerating toward the northern Gulf Coast (High Island TX–Grand Isle LA) late Friday
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: south-central Louisiana coast, near Cameron–Pecan Island corridor

weather_observation.watch_coast: High Island, TX to Grand Isle, LA (hurricane); High Island, TX to AL/FL border (storm-surge)
weather_observation.warning_coast: None issued for Texas coastline at this time
weather_observation.impacted_coast: High Island, TX to Cameron, LA including Sabine Lake and Calcasieu Lake expected to see 2–4 ft surge and tropical-storm winds
weather_observation.wind: High chance (59%) of 34-kt (39-mph) winds and 23% chance of 50-kt winds Friday afternoon–night; brief hurricane-force gusts possible if the core jogs west.
weather_observation.storm_surge: 2–4 ft inundation possible along Sabine Lake and lower Neches River, with minor coastal flooding around Beaumont’s approach channels Friday into early Saturday.
weather_observation.rainfall: 4–8 inches of rainfall possible Friday–Saturday with locally higher totals; risk of flash and urban flooding in port facilities and access roads.
weather_observation.other_hazards: A few tornadoes possible in outer rain-bands; dangerous rip currents and elevated seas will disrupt pilot boarding and cargo operations before landfall.
